example_sentence: The ancient Romans used an abacus for calculations.
The abandonee of the shipwreck was rescued by a passing freighter.
He would not abase himself by apologizing to his accuser.
She was not at all abashed by his open admiration.
The landlord offered a rent abatement due to the ongoing construction noise.
Animal welfare activists protested outside the abattoir.
The king decided to abdicate his throne in favor of his son.
His aberrant behavior was a cause for concern among his colleagues.
The sudden drop in temperature was an aberration for this time of year.
He was accused of aiding and abetting the criminals.
The plans for the new building are being held in abeyance until the funding is secured.
She abhors any form of discrimination.
You must abide by the rules of the agreement.
The refugees were living in abject poverty.
He was forced to abjure his former beliefs.
The ritual involved a ceremonial ablution before prayer.
She abnegated her rights to the inheritance.
Slavery was abolished in the 19th century.
I abominate cruelty towards animals.
The aboriginal peoples of Australia have a rich cultural history.
The peace talks proved to be abortive.
The rough rope abraded his skin.
The editor decided to abridge the lengthy novel.
The government sought to abrogate the old treaty.
The abscission of leaves occurs in autumn.
His conversation was so banal that I soon grew bored.
The baneful effects of excessive screen time on children are well-documented.
The ancient tribe was known for its barbaric rituals.
She was beguiled by his charm and good looks.
The new skyscraper was a concrete behemoth dominating the city skyline.
His bellicose statements worried diplomats seeking a peaceful resolution.
The benevolent dictator was admired for his efforts to improve his people's lives.
Fortunately, the tumor was benign and easily removed.
The artist's valuable collection was a generous bequest to the museum.
The path bifurcated, offering two different routes to the summit.
His bigoted views on immigration were widely condemned.
The con artist tried to bilk elderly investors out of their savings.
She blanched at the sight of the accident.
His controversial remarks were seen by many as an act of blasphemy.
The company's blatant disregard for environmental regulations led to hefty fines.
Urban decay is a blight on many modern cities.
Dark clouds on the horizon bode ill for our picnic plans.
The politician's speech was full of bombastic rhetoric but lacked substance.
He criticized the bourgeois values of his conservative upbringing.
His bovine expression indicated a lack of understanding.
His display of bravado masked his inner fear.

chinese_meaning: 控制；約束；（因生氣或受侮辱而）抬頭
example_sentence: She bridled at the suggestion that she was incompetent.
They faced a brobdingnagian task of cleaning up the entire city after the storm.
The painting depicted a serene bucolic scene with grazing sheep.
The burgeoning tech industry created many new job opportunities.
